thread.title: Giants' Victor Cruz suffers setback; Sunday return in doubt - Sports
thread.title_full: Giants' Victor Cruz suffers setback; Sunday return in doubt - Sports - NorthJersey.com

author: ART STAPLETON
title: Giants' Victor Cruz suffers setback; Sunday return in doubt - Sports
text:
EAST RUTHERFORD – Victor Cruz was convinced his return would happen this Sunday.
Buy this photo AP FILE PHOTO Giants wide receiver Victor Cruz during training camp this summer. (AP File Photo/Frank Franklin II) So saying the Giants and their star wide receiver were blindsided by his latest setback would be an understatement.
Cruz was forced to leave the practice field Wednesday following individual drills upon feeling aggravation in his left calf muscle when running routes.
His status for Sunday’s game against the Buffalo Bills in Orchard Park, N.Y., is now in serious doubt, considering Cruz has not gone through a full practice without limitation since Aug. 17. He is also coming off surgery last October to repair a torn patellar tendon in his right knee suffered in a game against the Eagles in Philadelphia.
“Victor came out and tried to do individuals,” Giants coach Tom Coughlin said. “He felt the calf again and that’s all he did.”
Wide receiver Rueben Randle said teammates could see Cruz was a bit tentative when he had to push off the calf and go full speed up field.
“I don’t think he’s too far away," Randle said, "but I don’t think he’s quite there yet.”
